data.title: Code highlight issue -- support Jekyll front matter
data.body:
Jekyll front matter may be added to the top of any file and it is signified by `---` and `---` to contain extra content.

This is erroneously being interpreted as HTML by Atom. In this example you can see the `&` symbol showing an error because it is not valid HTML.

![screen shot 2015-02-25 at 2 31 36 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/382183/6378706/12f8eb60-bcfb-11e4-8620-770c889f078e.png)

data.title: Make package activation function optional
data.body:
Now that we have services and config that both use other exported properties from the package's main module,  implementing and exporting an `activate` function should be optional.

`deactivate` was already optional so this makes the two consistent with each other.

Packages just using services will no longer need a no-op `activate` function exported.

data.title: Failed to activate package - can we improve user notification ?
data.body:
I am the developer of a package https://atom.io/packages/supercollider

Recently the package stopped working due to 6to5 raising an issue with unsafe use of eval in a dependency of a dependency of a dependency of atom-supercollider. Its functionality that is not even being used in atom-supercollider
1. The user isn't informed that the package failed to activate, has to look in console 
2. There is no report in the Packages pane for atom-supercollider
3. Developer (moi) who uses apm link does not experience this particular issue

For 1 I think that the nice red pop up panel should have been activated and allow the user to report the issue.

For 2 I suggest marking the package as "failed to activate" in some way. But maybe handling 1 is enough.

For 3: As a developer I was unaware that this was happening. I'm using the package with apm link so it doesn't get processed in the same way.  I had to unlink and then install it to see the error.

I can separate these issues if you want.

Error posted below. 

Its depd (which ironically is a package for reporting deprecations) which is in express which is used by supercollider.js (my npm module). Express isn't used by my atom package, so I can factor that functionality into a separate npm module.

Hi :), 

I couldn't find a way how to debug any random javascript file in built in developer tool bar. It is possible to debug packages but not the any other files? What am I missing?

data.title: Packages not "Clickable" to find out more
data.body:
So when you want to find more about a particular package, it is not possible.

For example:

![annoying3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/878780/6374348/2e1a24a6-bd08-11e4-95a6-bcbca37e15fd.png)

If I want to know what "color-picker" is, I can't since it won't allow me to go into the pane to find out more. This also does not work for many other packages and means I have to sometimes install them, to find out more.

data.title: Fold icon shown in gutter for all physical lines of soft-wrapped line
data.body:
Taken from https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/5567#issuecomment-75758499

Each physical line has a fold icon if the soft-wrapped line has nested lines. Instead, I expected only the first physical line to have the fold icon (that's also the behavior in Sublime).

![2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/38924/6350280/af5dd9da-bc32-11e4-9e2d-83b5c07c9373.gif)

data.title: Clicking the gutter for soft-wrapped lines selects the physical line instead of the logical line
data.body:
Taken from https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/5567#issuecomment-75758499.

When I click on the line's number in the gutter, I expected to see the whole logical line to be selected (that's the behavior in Sublime, for example). Instead, only the physical line is selected (kind of, it strange):

![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/38924/6350264/964de4e4-bc32-11e4-8e79-e7f61220a2c5.gif)

data.title: Change "Do you want to quit" buttons
data.body:
Basically, this is quite annoying me. Whenever I go to quite an application the buttons are:

"Save", "Cancel", "Don't Save"

I am so used to having:

"Save", "Don't Save", "Cancel"

From switching from Text Sublime. This problem is slightly annoying as whenever I don't want to save, I end up clicking cancel and having to do the process again. 

Apologies if this has already been brought up!

![annoying](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/878780/6371609/6a03ad74-bcf5-11e4-8bfd-372e703c0608.png)

data.title: Background CPU usage
data.body:
I'm running Atom 0.182.0 on Mac OS X 10.10.3. Atom is launched, and with a (Ruby on Rails) project open, but it's in the background while I'm doing something entirely unrelated to it, or the files that it currently has open. (I'm in Safari, submitting a new GitHub issue!) Yet Atom is still chewing through the CPU in the background. iStat Menus is reporting it at ~40% CPU usage on one of the cores.

This is suboptimal because it's reducing my battery life. Last night, sat in front of the TV, my laptop ran through the battery in a couple of hours, when it would normally have lasted much longer.

I realise this isn't a helpful bug report so far. What information can I give you to help turn it into a good bug report?

data.title: Variable UI font-size
data.body:
This issue acts as the "umbrella" for everything related to a variable UI font-size. Other related issues: https://github.com/atom/styleguide/pull/25, #4342, #3792,  https://github.com/atom/settings-view/issues/307, https://github.com/atom/atom-dark-ui/issues/24
#### Problem:

Unlike the Syntax font size, there isn't an easy way to change the font size for the UI.
#### Current options:

**1. Styles.less** Anything can be overridden in `styles.less`. Works great for tweaks in certain areas, but can't really be used to override all font sizes at once.

**2. Themes** Themes that are based on the `rem/em` units can be scaled by only changing the root element like `html { font-size: 14px; }`. To my knowledge, currently only [isotope-ui](https://atom.io/themes/isotope-ui) supports that.

**3. Zoom** It's possible to change the zoom level in `init.coffee`:

``` coffee
require('web-frame').setZoomFactor(2)
```

[See this discussion](https://discuss.atom.io/t/how-to-set-the-font-for-the-settings-ui-and-the-command-browser/13498/4). Works for all themes, but could have some px rounding issues.
#### Possible improvements (future):
1. Add a way to override Less variables from `styles.less`, themes and in the settings. There was an attempt but needs to be investigated further: https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/4153#issuecomment-73980380 
2. Switch everything to `rem/em` based font units. But this won't happen for 1.0 since it might break existing themes, packages and people's `styles.less`. Maybe for 2.0 if overriding Less variables isn't possible till then.

data.title: delete EOL: remove preceding whitespace of line
data.body:
In the case where you have the cursor at the end of the line, and press delete to remove then EOL, any whitespace at the beginning of the following line should be removed before it is added to the line where the cursor is on. Perhaps only the bit of whitespace that matches with the start of the line the cursor is in (indentation).
This behaviour would act reversly of when enter is pressed and the newly created line is started with the (indentation) white-space of the preceding line.

data.title: SetTextInBufferRange resseting range column to zero
data.body:
Hi guys  :),

I have question about setTextInBufferRange. I would like to create wrap in tag functionality so I want to indent selected text and put opening and closing tag one line before and one line after the selection. Problem is that if line before and line after are empty (their length is set to zero) column in range is set to zero too. 

For example text which i want to surround starts at 8th column(after indentation), brackets should be on column 4(depending on tab length) but they are placed on column 0 by setTextInBufferRange

I am curious whats the idea behind this and what should I do differently?

Code :

```
range = selection.getBufferRange()
selection.indent()
start = range.start
end = range.end
editor.setTextInBufferRange([[start.row - 1, start.column],[start.row - 1, end.column]],"<>")
editor.setTextInBufferRange([[start.row + 1, start.column],[start.row + 1, end.column]],"</>")


```

data.title: Unable to build on CentOS 6.5
data.body:
This issue may be related to issue #2177. 

My system is 
- Cent OS 6.5
- node v0.10.36
- npm 1.4.28

It is important to note that **libgnome-keyring-dev** is not available from the Cent OS 6 repos, so I was unable to install it. I was able to **install gnome-keyring**, but that obviously doesn't have the development headers.

I originally tried to download and run the latest rpm, but I was given the following output.

```
$ atom
/usr/local/share/atom/atom: /usr/lib64/libstdc++.so.6: version `GLIBCXX_3.4.14' not found (required by /usr/local/share/atom/atom)
/usr/local/share/atom/atom: /usr/lib64/libstdc++.so.6: version `GLIBCXX_3.4.15' not found (required by /usr/local/share/atom/atom)
/usr/local/share/atom/atom: /lib64/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.14' not found (required by /usr/local/share/atom/atom)
/usr/local/share/atom/atom: /usr/lib64/libstdc++.so.6: version `GLIBCXX_3.4.15' not found (required by /usr/local/share/atom/libchromiumcontent.so)
/usr/local/share/atom/atom: /lib64/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.14' not found (required by /usr/local/share/atom/libchromiumcontent.so)
/usr/local/share/atom/atom: /lib64/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.14' not found (required by /usr/local/share/atom/libgcrypt.so.11)
/usr/local/share/atom/atom: /lib64/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.15' not found (required by /usr/local/share/atom/libgcrypt.so.11)
```

I followed all of the guides, multiple times, but I am still unable to successfully build Atom from source. The output I get when attempting to build is as follows:

data.title: Files are scrolled to top when updated externally
data.body:
steps to reproduce
1. open a log file in atom
2. scroll part way down the file
3. add new line to end of log file with an external tool/editor and save
4. go back and view the log file in atom

expected
- log file is reloaded
- log file scroll position is still part way down (same as in step 2 above)

actual
- log file is reloaded (PASS)
- log file scroll position goes back to top (FAIL)

Every time a new line is added externally the editor reloads it (as it should) but it jumps to the top which makes it impossible to read log files while they're been written because atom constantly jump back to the top.

data.title: Add note on "+1 comments" to CONTRIBUTING
data.body:
cc @atom/core 

In my heart I just want to say that "+1 comments will be deleted" but that's a strong hand. Let's start with a kind suggestion.

data.title: Improve Atom's multi-folder workflow
data.body:
Once all of Atom's bundled packages have basic support for multiple root folders, we should step back and consider how Atom's multi-folder support could be improved. Atom users, if you have observations or ideas about how we could better support working on multiple projects concurrently, please share them here.

Note that even basic multi-folder support isn't complete yet. To track that, see https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/770#issuecomment-75345186. Also, if you have anything to report that's obviously a bug, **please make a separate issue for it**.

/cc @atom/core @atom/non-github-maintainers

I'll summarize/dedupe the ideas we come up with:
- Rename tree-view commands to clarify `Add Folder` vs `Add Root Folder` - @50Wliu
- Persist combinations of root folders via an explicit project file, not based on which paths were originally opened - @wvanlint
- `atom path1 path2` should always result in both paths being added to the project, even if `path2` had previously been manually removed from the project last time Atom was opened with those paths - @D-side
- Project files should be strictly optional - @mark-hahn 
- Project files should be implemented in a way that would later allow storing project-specific settings - @lee-dohm.
- Multiple folders need to be sortable - @andyburke

data.title: Tracking Issue: Decouple Services API versioning from package versioning
data.body:
Changing the `status-bar` Services API versioning:
- [x] Change `status-bar` Services API current version to `1.0.0` https://github.com/atom/status-bar/pull/57
  - [x] Create a legacy method to depreciate with Grim
  - [x] fix branch spec bug https://github.com/atom/status-bar/pull/58
- [x] Update atom/atom with new `status-bar` version https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/5755
- [x] Update consuming package to use `^1.0.0`
  - [x] `grammar-selector` https://github.com/atom/grammar-selector/pull/17
  - [x] `encoding-selector` https://github.com/atom/encoding-selector/pull/20
  - [x] `incompatible-packages` https://github.com/atom/incompatible-packages/pull/6
  - [x] `release-notes` https://github.com/atom/release-notes/pull/34
  - [x] `vim-mode` https://github.com/atom/vim-mode/pull/542
- [x] After Atom 0.187 publish minor on packages
  - [x] `vim-mode` publish
  - [x] `release-notes` publish
  - [x] `incompatible-packages` publish
  - [x] `encoding-selector` publish 
  - [x] `grammar-selector` publish
- [x] Update atom/atom to use new versions of each :arrow_heading_up: for 0.188 https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/5926
- [x] After 0.188 add depreciation back to `status-bar` https://github.com/atom/status-bar/pull/63
  - [x] `status-bar` publish minor
- [x] Update atom/atom with new `status-bar` version https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/6084
- [x] Blog post! https://github.com/atom/blog.atom.io/pull/90

data.title: Using proxy server with Atom is very complex
data.body:
You can configure Atom (OSX) to use a HTTP proxy as follows:
1. Add proxy info to APM:
   
   ```
   apm config set proxy http://localhost:9999
   apm config set http-proxy http://localhost:9999
   apm config set strict-ssl false # only add if needed - may be required if your proxy uses a non-globally-accepted SSL cert
   ```
2. Run `HTTP_PROXY="http://127.0.0.1:9999" HTTPS_PROXY="http://127.0.0.1:9999" atom --proxy-server="http://127.0.0.1:9999"`
3. You can now update Atom & packages/themes from within Atom.

(sidenote: git clones still won't work and require proxy configuration in `$HOME/.gitconfig` or `$HOME/.ssh/config`.)

This is reallllllly complex, and AFAICT not documented anywhere. I cobbled together this information from:
- atom/atom-shell#584
- atom/atom#1807 (very helpful)
- atom/atom-shell#183

This ticket is about the following issues:
- Atom needs proxy config specified three ways (should only need to specify this data in once)
- There's no documentation of this process (steps should be mentioned in the manual)

data.title: Atoms opens the union of the given paths and the paths specified by the project
data.body:
I normally start Atom using its icon which runs it without arguments under the home path.
I can then remove the home path as the root folder and add some other root folders that I am working on.
However, when I restart Atom, the home path will be re-added as a root folder which seems unexpected.

As far as I can tell from the code, projects/workspaces are uniquely identified under ~/.atom/storage by the paths that are given on the command line (the path that the command is executed from if there are no paths given). Is this correct?
Would only opening the project paths as root folders be suitable over also opening the given paths as root folders if and only if the project exists?
If the project path doesn't contain some of the given paths, that means the user has manually removed them, given the unique identifier of the project.

If there is interest in any changes, I would be excited to work on it @maxbrunsfeld  :)

data.title: Uncaught Error: Can't undo with an open transaction
data.body:
Looks like https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4817 has resurfaced.

Additional environment details: This is a guest VM running in VirtualBox for host OS Windows 7 64-bit.  At the time the error occurred, I had a momentary slow down, where atom / the VM was not responding quickly.  I **think** what happened, is I did <ctrl>x a second time on a highlighted word before the first had been processed, and my finger slipped over and also did a <ctrl>z.  Don't really know which got there first.  I saw the same thing with an older version of atom (about 0.173), but ignored it when I saw the 'already reported' message.  This time I had a look at the report, and saw that it had been closed.

Just incase it overlaps.  I saw some reports about problems using split tabs.  When the error occurred, there were no splits, but earlier in the session I had 3 splits open (Split Down) for a single file, editing in all 3.

As you can see from the config report, this is a pretty bare environment.  Quite new to using atom, and have not done any real customizing, other than tabs-to-spaces.

After collecting the details for reporting, the session continued.  A couple of undo operations got things back where the should be.  Save, Exit, restarted, just to be safe :)

**Atom Version**: 0.182.0-d1e6dba
**System**: linux 3.18.7-200.fc21.i686
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught Error: Can't undo with an open transaction

```
At /opt/atom/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/history.js:76

Error: Can't undo with an open transaction
    at History.module.exports.History.undo (/opt/atom/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/history.js:76:15)
    at TextBuffer.module.exports.TextBuffer.undo (/opt/atom/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/text-buffer.js:679:27)
    at TextEditor.module.exports.TextEditor.undo (/opt/atom/share/atom/resources/app/src/text-editor.js:1186:26)
    at TextEditor.atom.commands.add.stopEventPropagation.core:undo (/opt/atom/share/atom/resources/app/src/text-editor-element.js:318:19)
    at atom-text-editor.newCommandListeners.(anonymous function) (/opt/atom/share/atom/resources/app/src/text-editor-element.js:286:32)
    at CommandRegistry.module.exports.CommandRegistry.handleCommandEvent (/opt/atom/share/atom/resources/app/src/command-registry.js:243:29)
    at /opt/atom/share/atom/resources/app/src/command-registry.js:3:61
    at KeymapManager.module.exports.KeymapManager.dispatchCommandEvent (/opt/atom/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/atom-keymap/lib/keymap-manager.js:558:16)
    at KeymapManager.module.exports.KeymapManager.handleKeyboardEvent (/opt/atom/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/atom-keymap/lib/keymap-manager.js:396:22)
    at HTMLDocument.module.exports.WindowEventHandler.onKeydown (/opt/atom/share/atom/resources/app/src/window-event-handler.js:176:20)
```
### Commands

```
     -0:22.6 editor:move-to-end-of-screen-line (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
  2x -0:21.9 editor:move-to-beginning-of-word (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:20.6 core:move-left (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:20.4 editor:select-to-end-of-line (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:19.7 core:cut (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
  2x -0:19.4 editor:move-to-end-of-word (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:17.9 editor:move-to-beginning-of-word (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:17.0 core:move-left (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:16.4 core:paste (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:11.1 editor:move-to-end-of-screen-line (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:10.4 editor:select-to-beginning-of-word (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:09.8 core:select-left (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:09.1 core:cut (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:09.1 core:undo (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:02.6 core:cut (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:02.4 core:move-right (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
```
### Config

``` json
{
  "core": {},
  "editor": {
    "invisibles": {},
    "autoIndentOnPaste": false,
    "showInvisibles": true,
    "fontSize": 14
  }
}
```
### Installed Packages

``` coffee
# User
tabs-to-spaces, v0.8.1

# Dev
No dev packages
```
